name: hex-hover-converter
description: Provides conversion between decimal, hex and binary numbers while hovering.

hexHoverConverter.formatString.Decimal.description:
Format string for decimal source values.
Any text inside <...> brackets will be replaced with the corresponding value.
Use the following variables: {dec} for the hovered decimal value, {dec_to_hex} for the converted hexadecimal value, and {dec_to_bin} for the converted binary value.
Clear this string to omit the conversion.

hexHoverConverter.formatString.SignedDec.description:
Format string for signed decimal source values.
This will be used only if the decimal value is prepended by a minus sign.
Any text inside <...> brackets will be replaced with the corresponding value.
Use the following variables: {sdec} for the hovered signed decimal value, {sdec_to_hex} for the converted hexadecimal value, and {sdec_to_bin} for the converted binary value.
Clear this string to omit the conversion.

hexHoverConverter.formatString.Hexadecim.description:
Format string for hexadecimal source value.
Any text inside <...> brackets will be replaced with the corresponding value.
Use the following variables: {hex} for the hovered decimal value, {hex_to_dec} for the converted hexadecimal value, and {hex_to_bin} for the converted binary value.
Clear this string to omit the conversion.

hexHoverConverter.formatString.Binary.description:
Format string for binary source value.
Any text inside <...> brackets will be replaced with the corresponding value.
Use the following variables: {bin} for the hovered binary value, {bin_to_hex} for the converted hexadecimal value, and {bin_to_dec} for the converted decimal value.
Clear this string to omit the conversion.

hexHoverConverter.hexRecognition.strict.description: Recognize hexadecimal numbers only if they have a prefix (e.g., 0x or $) or suffix (e.g., h).
